meanings: be quite at a loss what to do

meanings.meaning: not know whether you're coming or going
in the lap of the gods

vlive.korean: [어찌 됐든 미션 하나 더 성공!] 20점부터 분식이었죠? [Anyways, we succeeded again!] We can have a set of snacks from 20 points? 듣기 View video TOMORROW X TOGETHER : TO DO X TOMORROW X TOGETHER 2020 - EP.7
vlive.english: [Anyways, we succeeded again!] We can have a set of snacks from 20 points?

vlive.korean: 그래서 어찌어찌 해서 이렇게 오랜만에 돌아왔습니다, 그렇죠, 수빈이 형? So here we are. Right, SOOBIN? 듣기 View video TOMORROW X TOGETHER : 수빈&휴닝카이 : 뚝딱뚝딱 공작시간
vlive.english: So here we are. Right, SOOBIN?

vlive.korean: [어찌 내게 이런 일이!] [How could this happen!] View video 내 전공은 힙합(My major is HIPHOP) : Ep 9. “진짜 팬 됐어요” 송민호에게 자극 준 대힙 래퍼의 등장!? 경희대 국제캠 “래빈”
왜냐면 제가 어찌 됐든 뭔가 그... Because either way, that... 듣기 View video AB6IX : 다시‼️
어찌됐든 너무 감사하고요 지금... Anyway, thank you very much. 듣기 View video NU'EST : [NU’EST] 러브들에게 홀릭☕️

examples.korean: Somehow we kept the boat afloat. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 어찌어찌 해서 우린 보트가 계속 물 위에 떠 있게는 했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Somehow we kept the boat afloat. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: He managed to repair the car by himself. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그는 혼자 힘으로 어찌어찌 그 차를 고쳤다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He managed to repair the car by himself. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: The ball somehow bobbled into the net. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그 공이 통통 튀어 어찌어찌 골망 속으로 들어갔다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The ball somehow bobbled into the net. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: I was tied up, but managed to work myself free. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 나는 묶여 있었지만 어찌어찌 해서 몸을 풀었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: I was tied up, but managed to work myself free. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Somehow we managed to raise her to her feet. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 어찌어찌 해서 우리는 간신히 그녀를 일으켜 세웠다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Somehow we managed to raise her to her feet. Add to Wordbook
